newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal parliament approves liberalising telecoms.
newsitem.headline: Portugal parliament approves liberalising telecoms.

text.p: Portugal's parliament has approved a government bill liberalising the country's telecommunications sector fully from 2000.
The law presented by the minority Socialist government will end the need for state control of Portugal Telecom.
The government has already sold off 49 percent of the telecommunications group and intends to float a further tranche in the autumn.
Most European Union countries must liberalise their telecommunications sectors fully by 1998 but Portugal, Spain and Greece have been given more time to complete the process.
